title: Approximately what percentage of book authors actually make a living from it? - Quora

response.answer_text: I’ve been working in the editorial, publishing and printing trades for 35+ years. I’ve also worked with world-class authors. I have to say a great majority of book authors (all genres) don’t make a living from their writing. Indeed, nearly all of the authors I’ve worked with have had to hold down conventional jobs and careers — lawyers, accountants, doctors, advertising types — and even one janitor. Only a very tiny minority of book authors actually reach the stellar heights of making a livable living from writing. The only workable writing area with a livable living is journalism — but that’s nearly always salaried employment. It’s a steady monthly salary in exchange for NOT writing stuff that you like.
